CatDescriptText: Mrs. Gloria Grate, beautician, 7413 Stranahan St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "No.  As a group they are courteous.  Recently, a Peoples Cab driver fixed a flat tire for me when I was stranded after midnight."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gloria Golden Grate, leaning with crossed arms on car, houses in background
